qas.question: Natural selection and what makes certain dogs behave certain ways?
What distinguishes different types of dogs from one another?
Who keeps classifications of different dog breeds?
What is responsible for different dog types and breeds today?
Animals that share characteristics that are different than what other animals in that species have is known as what?
Modern dog breeds are what type of classification which is maintained by modern kennel clubs?

context: While all dogs are genetically very similar, <a3_0>natural selection and <a0_0>selective <a1_0>breed<a1_0/>ing<a3_0/><a0_0/> have reinforced certain characteristics in certain populations of dogs, giving rise to dog types and dog <a4_0>breeds<a4_0/>. Dog types are broad categories based on function, genetics, or characteristics. Dog breeds are groups of animals that possess a set of inherited characteristics that distinguishes them from other animals within the same species. Modern dog breeds are <a5_0>non-scientific<a5_0/> classifications of dogs kept by <a2_0>modern kennel clubs.
